item.title: Measuring the Adiabatic Non-Hermitian Berry Phase in Feedback-Coupled Oscillators
item.description: In this work we verify experimentally that the adiabatic non-Hermitian Berry phase is a purely geometrical effect that leads to significant amplification and damping of the amplitude also for non-cyclical paths within the parameter space even when all eigenenergies are real. We further observe a non-Hermitian analog of the Aharonov–Bohm solenoid effect.

item.title: Measuring the adiabatic Non-Hermitian Berry Phase in Feedback-Coupled Oscillators
item.description: In this talk I presented our most recent work at the University of Catania. It was the first time I ever presented my work! We measured for the first time the Berry phase in the case of a non-Hermitian Hamiltonian using a mechanical metamaterial.

item.title: Measuring the Adiabatic non-Hermitian Berry Phase in Feedback-Coupled Harmonic Oscillators
item.description: For the first time since I began my PhD, I was able to spend more time traveling for conferences. In particular, I presented this poster at the Theory of Condensed Matter (TCM) Meeting, at the University of Warwick, then a few weeks later I took part to the conference on Condensed Matter and Quantum Materials (CMQM) organised by the Institute of Physics (IoP) at the University of Bath, and finally I have presented it at the University of Strathclyde, Glasgow, for the conference on Designing Out of Eequilibrium many-body Quantum systems (DesOEQ).
